text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly addresses the distinction between admissibility and jurisdiction by noting that the UNCITRAL Rules permitting counterclaims procedurally 'doesn't resolve the jurisdictional consent question' (Section I). Furthermore, the discussion on the Applicable Law (Section III) clearly separates the question of whether a domestic law counterclaim is 'admissible' (jurisdiction ratione materiae) from the tribunal's power to apply that law, contrasting restrictive approaches (BIT-only jurisdiction) with expansive ones, which directly engages the concept of jurisdictional scope versus procedural admissibility.", "criterion_id": "5bd9c5b8-913d-4e37-8ca4-67a98f63820c"}
